required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post Market Clinical Follow-Up for ED Coil / Electro-detach Generator v4
clinical_study.official_title: Post Market Clinical Follow-Up for ED Coil / Electro-detach Generator v4

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter post-marketing clinical follow-up study to collect safety and performance data in a prospective cohort of patients who will have undergone coil embolization using the ED Coil and ED Detach Generator v4.

primary_outcome.description: The recanalization in aneurysms will be classified using the Raymond-Roy Classification. The outcomes following embolization of arteriovenous malformations and arteriovenous fistula will be classified as follows complete occlusion/subtotal occlusion/ partial occlusion

The recanalization in aneurysms will be classified using the Raymond-Roy Classification. The outcomes following embolization of arteriovenous malformations and arteriovenous fistula will be classified as follows complete occlusion/subtotal occlusion/ partial occlusion

primary_outcome.measure: Safety Measure - Assessment of Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: All adverse events will be recorded, along with their seriousness and relatedness to the device or the procedure.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At embolization procedure, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: The technical properties of the ED Electrodetach Generator v4 will be assessed by successful coil detachment (yes/no)

primary_outcome.time_frame: At embolization procedure, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: The technical properties of the ED Electrodetach Generator v4 will be assessed by the the number of detachment attempts

intervention.description: The ED Coil is used for vascular embolization with a platinum coil at the target lesion in a patient's blood vessel. The ED Detach Generator is intended to for use solely to detach the platinum coil from the delivery catheter of the ED Coil.

study_pop.textblock: All patients with an aneurysm, arteriovenous malformation, or arteriovenous fistula and eligible for endovascular treatment with ED Coil and ED Detach Generator v4.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients are over 18 years of age.
- Patients will undergo catheter embolization using the Kaneka ED Coil with the ED Detach Generator v4 for aneurysm, arteriovenous malformation (AVM), or arteriovenous fistula (AFV)
- The patient, or his/her representative, has agreed to the informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patient, or his/her representative, is unwilling or unable to agree to the informed consent.
